What is the purpose of the `decodescript` command in Verus?
The `decodescript` command in Verus is used to decode a script that has been encoded in hexadecimal (hex) format.
How do I use the `decodescript` command to decode a hex-encoded script in Verus?

To decode a hex-encoded script in Verus, you can use the `decodescript` command followed by the hex-encoded script, like this: `decodescript "hex"`. This will decode the script and display the result.
What kind of input does the `decodescript` command expect?
The `decodescript` command expects a hex-encoded script as input.
